short_summary: Replace the Walker Bridge over the Frenchman River in Grasslands National Park
description: Replace the Walker Bridge located in Grasslands National Park in Saskatchewan. The project includes the construction of a new concrete and steel short-span bridge, realignment of the gravel road to the new bridge, demolition and environmentally friendly disposal of the existing timber bridge and road access, and site restoration. The work will be completed by November 30, 2024, and the site will be made available to the contractor in mid-July 2024. This project aims to minimize environmental and archaeological impacts.
full_summary:
# Walker Bridge Replacement Project: Stage 2

## Project Overview
Parks Canada solicits the replacement of the Walker Bridge over the Frenchman River in Grasslands National Park, Saskatchewan. The project involves the construction of a new concrete and steel short-span bridge, realignment of a gravel grid road, demolition of the existing bridge and road access, and site restoration.

## Technical Requirements
* Replacement of the Walker Bridge with a new short-span concrete and steel bridge
* Realignment of the gravel grid road to the new bridge
* Demolition and environmentally friendly disposal of the existing timber bridge and road access
* Site restoration to original condition

## Environmental Considerations
The project area is a critical habitat for multiple species at risk, including the Sage Grouse. Environmental protection and mitigation measures are required to minimize impacts on the site's biodiversity. Archaeological finds will also be protected.

## Project Timeline
* Contractor availability: mid-July 2024
* Work completion: November 30, 2024

## Two-Stage Selection Process
The project follows a two-stage selection process:

1. **This posting is the Stage Two of a two-stage solicitation process:** a preliminary evaluation of all interested suppliers will take place in **Stage One**.
2. **Invitation to bid**: qualified suppliers from **Stage One** will receive an invitation to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings.

## Contact Information
* Interested suppliers should contact: Ken Lacanilao, (587) 832-1894 or kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca

## Additional Information
Please visit the government website for more information. [link]
